intro: Castilleja pallida var. yukonis, commonly known as the Yukon Indian paintbrush, is a hemiparasitic flowering plant native to the western United States and parts of Canada. It belongs to the Orobanchaceae family and is characterized by its bright red to orange-red bracts that resemble paintbrushes. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and disturbed soils. It has small, scale-like leaves and relies on other plants for some of its nutrients through its root system. Its blooming period occurs in late spring to early summer, attracting various pollinators.
